When You have metal walls instead of rocks doesn't that strike you as odd? It was one of those films where its so bad you like it.
If people in the future are still this stupid, kill me now.

Review title: Won't get much better for a 10th....
Review_body: OK, Yeah it's the Tenth in the series. Don't expect an epic. Because this is not.To be honest, it's not got the biggest budget and at the tenth in a series, you won't really find incredible Oscar-winning actors, hence some of the acting remains a bit dodgy at parts throughout the film. Neither will you get awesome special effects and CGI, which this doesn't.However, if you love an insane story-line and lots of gore and murder and menace then this one delivers, and it delivers well. Kane Hodder as Jason definitely delivers the hulking figure and menace that Voorhees has and he does it so well. It's an action-packed hour and a half and not to be taken too seriously. So if you sit back and don't put too much thought into it, it's really quite enjoyable. I certainly did.Sit back and relax....

Review title: not as bad as people make it out to be
Review_body: When I saw the reviews for this movie all hope I had for this movie had been crushed then I saw the movie and I have to say I am confused why so many people hate this movie. It does have plot holes and it is pointless to put Jason in space but it is entertaining as hell. The movie is more or less a parody of the other Friday the 13th movies and it is very funny when it wants to be. My main problem with the movie is the bland and uninteresting characters which are just their to die. The only interesting characters are Bronsky and the android. The end is brilliant and is reminiscent of the other Friday the 13th movies. The kills are very uncreative. The only kill that is very creative and brutal is the first one Jason makes is space. All in all it is not for everyone but it is very entertaining and fun.

Review title: run away as it has HIV on it!!!
Review_body: I respect the Friday the 13th legend. Which I believe could have become a greater legend if left on its own. But as long as box office dollars are on the agenda, we will see far too many disasters as this one.For the movie, the undying Jason has been frozen in order to save mankind. But after a few centuries, accidentally a space ship finds the ship that Jason is inside, and again accidentally awakes him. Jason once again does what he does best and slicing everyone on the ship. Besides all the technology the humans have, this ship has only have automatic rifles even older than the US army now using.The worst moment was when the cyborg was modified, she kills Jason. But what the heck, all those frozen years has given Jason the ability to modify himself with any electrical cable that is not isolated. It was such a disaster.Bad movie, poor acting, low budget and a horrible series of bad ideas. Not to mention the lousy digital effects.Run away as it has HIV on it and you have an open scar..regards..

This just might be the worst movie I've ever seen. The whole thing is just so ridiculous. Nothing is at all realistic, the lines are cheesy, the acting is bad, Uber Jason????? What? I want to know who the editor was that looked at the final version of this movie and said "This looks good, I think we're finished." If I ever meet him, I'll slap him.The plot is terrible. Absolutely terrible. A bunch of people on a spaceship in the future find a frozen man with a machete. They now have some technology that re-animates frozen people. The captain of the ship talks to his "boss", who tells him to bring Jason back and make money off him. The captain knows that it is Jason Vorhees, but wakes him up anyway. A series of badly choreogrpahed slashings ensue and....well, you get the point.When I saw this movie, I laughed the whole way through. Not at their unfunny jokes, but at the fact that someone could make a movie so bad, and still take themselves seriously. I only suggest watching this movie if your cable is out and the only movie in your house is Jason X, and you are in the mood to laugh at someone. But seriously, I'm surprised that the filmmakers could sit through this and say "Wow, this is turning out well."

Review title: Screamingly funny, but throw away every logical thought!
Review_body: Contains spoiler I have to say, that I only saw parts 1 and 2 of this series and didn't like them very much. So my expectations were quite low! Of course, I also didn't expect an original story or really good actors. But I failed! With a Bodycount higher than most other Horror-Movies Jason works his way back on screen into an era of hightech- and just-for-fun-murderers. So this movie comes very self-ironic and funny, not just because the kills are very original, but also because of the unusual location and atmosphere. For an example: Jason throws a soldier onto some pile, nothing new. But after a few seconds, the corpse starts to turn on the pile and the pile appears as a screw were the corpse is now screwed... (I hope I was able to explain it quite well, in spite of my weak english...) So, I had a lot of fun, and if voting would already be accessible, I would give this movie a 7, just for all this fun and those really, really, really cool murder scenes! Go and watch it!

So, just seen Jason X. Just to say it in the beginning, I think Friday, 13th, Part III is still best of this series I've seen this far. I haven't seen all movies, though. I also think it's good they dropped the "Friday" in the title. It's all about Jason since part II anyway. If you want to know why slasher movies are barely made anymore, watch this movie: It's as mindless as it can get. Jason's there. He's invincible. He's murdering. No reason given for anything. He's just doing it. Don't wonder about anything, they won't explain it. Don't think the plot makes sense. Don't even expect a working story. It's all not important. The only thing you can hope for in slasher movies are cool, different locations, some brief nudity and different ways of killing people. And in this aspect, Jason X rocks. High budget. Cool sets. Cool special effects. Tons of gore and Jason slashes his evil heart out to the extreme with some very cool death scenes. I mean, freezing the head of a person, and then smashing this frozen head to pieces? Geez, who's getting such ideas. The thing Jason's doing with the sleeping bags gets a clever reprise. As far as I know, he did this in another part.
*minor spoilers*Also, Jason's not killing helpless civilians (students, read teenagers) only, but also has to deal with highly trained soldiers and a harmless bot, which got upgraded to a mean fighting machine ("'fraid I'm gonna have to hurt you now."). By the way, I absolutely love this bot. Witty remarks and an actress who obviously enjoyed her play. If you absolutely hate this movie, at least fast forward to the fight Jason vs. bot. It's the best scene of the movie. The end of the movie manages it in a believable way to get back on "earth". You even hear the typical "Friday, 13th" music... doors for the next part are open wide.Jason X is stealing from a lot of movies. Critters IV comes to mind, which is also based in a space-ship in the future. Also I think of Aliens (highly equipped soldiers dying, and a civilian yelling "Get them out of there!"), Aliens IV (existing monster gets reborn into an "uber monster") and Matrix (costume design of soldiers/bot, character gets martial arts training uploaded). The story is extremely stupid, and I think just watching this movie my IQ lowered some points, but it was fun to watch... and this is the most important thing, isn't it? For a normal movie I'd give it a 3/10, but rated as slasher movie it deserves a 8/10.

well after being a fan of the friday series since 1988 when i seen friday the 13th part 8: jason takes mannhaten at a local drivein i 've been hooked. since that summer when i was 1 1/2 i've rented, bought and seen everyone (exept for JGTH) at least 30 times! well now here comes JASON X. whatever happened to friday the 13th titles) anyway, i saw this movie on opening day and i was surprised that alotta people where buying tickets to JASON X. so i sat with my friends and i pretty much enjoyed every second of this movie. there were about 30 kills and intence action. the crystal lake scene was cool and funny. i loved the way Uber-Jason looked but for the sure tobe following sequels (11,12,13, and probably a freddy versus jason) his look should go back to normal Jason.   any way i give this a 10/10. this is the best sequel of the whole series.X,3,2,1,4,6,7,9,8,5 in order!

Review title: This movie was not that bad...
Review_body: I expected to see a cheezy, bad movie where you're supposed to be scared but nothing is ever scary (ie, blair witch project).  However, Jason X is not that bad of a movie.  It was mostly a comedy movie, with lots of gore (ie dead alive).  And to tell you the truth, I was pleasantly surprised.There are some things in the movie that are really predictable (just as you'd think) but there're some good parts too.  If you see this movie thinking it's going to be horrible, as I did, you'll walk out of the theatre with a smile.

Let me start by saying I don't like horror movies. I think they are trite gorefests whose only appeal is seeing people die in disgusting ways. A friend talked me into going to see Jason X, and I went to the matinee. Jason X was everything one expects from a slasher film- blood and guts, bad acting, cheesy music- but it was by far funnier than any slasher film I've seen. It never takes itself seriously, and that is the beauty of it. The characters don't seem to care that they are about to be killed as long as they can say some sarcastic remark before they get axed. Some of the deaths were inventive and a scene with two crystal lake camp counselors is the funniest thing I've seen at the movies all year. Don't see this movie if you are looking for award winning cinema, but I would recommend this for people looking for an entertaining movie.

I just saw the unrated and uncut version of this movie in a large cinema with over 1000 seats filled mostly with Jason fans, and I must say that this movie rocks. It has everything you would expect from a Friday the 13th movie... and more. Plenty of gore scenes, some funny and selfironic stuff, a lot of allusions to the other jason movies, many sexy dressed chicks and a really evil Jason on a killing spree. This is definitely one of the best Jason movies. When I first heard about this movie, I had my doubts about the futuristic theme, but it suits the movie very well (unlike Hellraiser IV) and adds some fresh ideas to the Friday the 13th series. Even the Terminator/Robocop like Jason at the end of the movie fits in well. If you're a fan of this genre, go watch it in a theater as soon as you can and definitely buy the DVD (but only if they release this uncut version)!

I just saw the movie, and I have to admit I was expecting to have wasted an afternoon.  This movie is very exciting, good special effects, and funny as hell.  See the movie, it is the most entertainment I've had from cinema in a while. =)

I saw the trailer.  The first thought that came to my mind was critters, alien resurrection and a few other... "Take it to Space" thrillers.  Most movies of this nature aren't really all that great.  It is the same story... "Get trapped in space, must fight to survive."This movie followed that, but the bad ass characters that normally make it through the movie died really fast in the beginning of the movie, leaving the weak to fend for themselves.  Again, Jason kills and can't be killed as in all the Friday the 13th movie.I watched the movie and to say the least, I enjoyed it.  It wasn't scary, but it kept in line with some classic themes and this time Jason took no prisoner and really showed how intelligent he was considering "He has such a small brain."  If you watch the movie, you'll get the "brain" part.Go and see it, it is worth the view.

This film really surprised me in a good way! I mean, okay, the story is pretty dull (Jason is now in space and becomes a half-robot), but - Friday the 13th movies have never been something for the intelligent among us, have they? In fact, Jason X is much better than the most of its predecessors. The actors aren't really good - but, on the other hand, they're a way better than the actors from, say, "Friday the 13th 4". The effects are really cool, especially the splatter effects (at best on the Europian DVD (NC-17 rating!). But the best thing about this film is the humor: There are lots of references to the earlier FT13th films (just watch the Virtual Reality scene near the end - hilarious!) and some funny dialogues. All in all, much more worth watching it than the most of us horror fans have expected.

Review title: Without doubt the best of all the sequels...
Review_body: I left the cinema after watching Jason X in stitches. Having seen nearly all of the Friday the 13th series and been more and more disappointed with the efforts of each it was fantastic to see a film take itself so lightly. As usual there was a fair amount of gore and teenage lust but the script has some, without trying to sound clichéd, killer jokes. The acting left a lot to be desired but this has come to be expected with this particular slasher series. The story is based around the context that Jason has been frozen in cryogenic stasis while the world around him has fallen to pieces and mankind has deserted the earth. That of course doesn't stop some meddling students on an interstellar field trip finding and defrosting him. Great idea kids! The result is a fiendishly funny and not entirely unscary film. It has its moments of corny dialogue (man falls on top of giant screw and twists down it - "he's screwed" is the line) but this is offset by some laugh out loud jokes. One especially good one is near the end so hang around even if your not enjoying it. I can only recommend this film to anyone looking for good solid entertainment and a film that takes itself lightly.

Review title: NO JOKE, GOOD CONTENDER FOR WORST MOVIE EVER
Review_body: I did not go see this movie with the highest expectations. Being a fan of the friday the 13th series, it interested me when i first heard that a new jason movie was coming out. First i heard it was freddy vs. jason, then finally i heard it was just another sequel. Well lo and behold, this movie screams of low-budget cheese factory. It was horrendously bad. The story is so awful, its hilarious. Its basically this-having finally caught and imprisoned jason, a female scientist tries to find ways to execute him(she says theyve tried everything from gas chamber to firing squad and he won't die)and finally gives up, so instead they will cryogenically freeze him forever. Then one of the head scientists decide they will keep him alive so they can study him. He laughably explains that jason has an amazing ability to heal, hence the difficulty of people trying to kill him. Anyway, he escapes being fully chained, then gets frozen, then defrosts and lives again only to keep killing everyone on sight for no reason. An absolute must see.

Review title: Oh my god! This movie rocked!
Review_body: I just went to see Jason X at the Movieplex and it was awesome! After months of waiting, It lived up to my every expection, and then some!!! Okay now to the story:After unsucessfuly trying to kill Jason, they deciede to freeze him. But something goes wrong and a woman freezes to. 400 hundred years later, space people find them and bring them to their ship and let them thaw out.Very creative killings, the upgrade scene made sence, overall great movie   10/10

OK - I know it was a horror movie, and on that end, it failed. It was also a comedy, and on that note, it was hilarious. If you can deal with the obvious mindless nonsense, and awful acting, go see it. It's so funny, you'll have tears in your eyes!!!

b-cuz it was so pathetic!!! seriously this movie is like the worst i've seen in my life!!! it's not scary at all and it's really stupid!! and there's a robot that loses her head?!?!?! c'mon ppl !!! don't waste ur money on this crap!!! i'm sorry i did!!! go c halloween 8 or something worth ur time(yes i know that doesn't come out till july 19) but still go c n e thing but this !!!

Jason X isn't a very bad sequel to the normal Friday the 13th sequels. Jason X takes place in 2455, earth is ruined and a group of archaelogist students, along with some soldiers and a teacher, take a trip to the ruined earth.  That's when they come across two frozen bodies. One, a VERY hot girl. The other, some freaky guy wearing a hockey mask and wielding a machete.  That's when the plot holes start to kick in. the first one, it is not very smart to thaw out a tall freak who is wearing a hockey mask and has a machete in his hand.  Now what kind of idiots thaw out a person like that? Our doomed students are.  So they unthaw the two bodies out and the first one is the hot girl.  She tells them not to unthaw the other one because it is the infamous Jason Voorhees.  But they're a little too late for that. Jason is already on the loose and might I add is VERY p**sed off.  Then comes the screaming and running and dying.Most of the characters in this flick are pretty cool, like the sexually curious android and the tough Sergeant who just won't die.  The fights between Jason and Kay-Em 14(the android) is very entertaining, along with the fight between Jason and Sergeant Broadski.  Most of this movie isn't as bad as critics say.  Jason gets to revisit Camp Crystal Lake circa 1980. He gets to entertain two pre-marital loving campers, and even redoes a classic death in Friday the 13th part 7 (I won't give it away.)  Overall this movie is good yet can live without the plot holes (So they just remember at the end they have an escape pod.) Rating 6 out of 10.

Review title: A whole load of friday fun
Review_body: Not many films can make it to there tenth outing and do it with this much style. Jason X is of course the big nineties (or should I say noughties?) remake of the series but its done with such loving care and such a good sense of humour that anyone who enjoys good silly horror fun will love it. It's not terrifying but it has great jump shocks, imaginative deaths (minor spoiler) especially the frozen head one, and great little jokes.  The film starts a few years from now in Camp Crystal Lake Research centre where Jason is being held.  Unable to execute him this is where Jason has ended up but then of course some government people who think they can contain Jason turn up, ignore the cute scientist warning and do what they want. Anyhoo without spoiling it too much Jason and the women scientist end up cryogenically frozen and are then found by a group of teenagers on an expidition led by their professor a few hundred years later.  The idea of putting Jason in space may sound silly but it is thoroughly enjoyable.  This film is cool. Trust me.

As far as im concerned.... Roger Ebert doesnt care about any movie that doesnt have love in it, or isnt a chick flick... so his opinion on anything means squat - so listen to someone who knows=)yeah, 10 movies in a slasher series is a bit much.. and this is hands down the worst of the series.. (which is saying a lot.. since they did make VIII - Jason Takes Manhattan) .. This one, much like VIII .. has *NOTHING* to do with the storyline, other than stab, hack, slash kill...  Highlights: few Really cool kill scenes... couple laughs. Downfalls: its in space, Jason Turns into some uber-elite space geeked out metal-freak (which really.. ruined the movie) .. overall. rent it when every other decent movie is out of stock @ the video store..

I went to this movie with little expectations, and I believe that's the best way to see it. Don't bring your brains 'cause you won't be needing them. I only had seen the first of the Friday the 13th movies, a movie that I liked a lot, the 80s were the best decade for slasher movies.As a slasher movie, the way it was intended to be, Jason X totally sucks, but actually this movie was so bad, that I liked it. The one-liners are very silly and unfunny, but in a way that they become funny again like for example SPOILER when Jason throws one of the soldiers on a screw, another soldiers reports that his friend is screwed END SPOILER.Of course this isn't oscar material, but if you look at it as a comedy, you might find it entertaining.

I can't believe that some people actually enjoyed this movie, I mean, it's the biggest load of crap I have ever seen in my entire life, and I have seen my share of horrible horror movies.When I first watched "Jason goes to hell", I thought to myself: if I ignore that it's part of the Friday the 13th saga, this movie isn't so bad, it's stupid yes, but it can kind of be entertaining.Now, as far as Jason X is concerned, you can pretend that it's a completely new idea, with a completely new serial killer and it still it's preposterous.The simple notion of having Jason go to space is ridiculous, I mean really, how many of us think of the space as scary? Granted, alien was an awesome movie, but it was a horror movie with a creature FROM space, not a serial killer that hides in the woods and used to chop off teenagers that smoked pot and had 'round the clock sex (good old times, sigh) that's suddenly shipped off to space.As for the contents of the movie, the acting is totally lame, (it kind of looks like some bad TV movie acting), the sets are incredibly badly built, and what the hell was that? Uber Jason? When I saw that I couldn't believe my eyes..Jason is freakin' terminator now? Fighting a robot chick (or whatever)? The doctor who got frozen with him was the worst female lead in a horror movie of all time, the rest of the remaining characters, god, i just wanted to dress myself as Jason and kill them all myself. they were so annoying, you just want to watch them die. And if the whole freaking world knows how dangerous Jason Vorhees is, WHY IN HELL WOULD SOMEOME WANT TO KEEP HIM ALIVE? Because he's a god damned zombie? Come on, get real..This movie just seems to be a stern of ludicrous ideas and an attempt to revitalize the Friday the 13th saga, which, imo, killed it instead. I am a huge Friday the 13th fan, but this movie is really horrible.I don't advise anyone to waste their time in this piece of crap, unless you want to rip out your eyeballs so you don't have to watch (which I almost did).Seriously, don't waste your time with this one, just not worth it, at all.

Even worse than JGTH to be honest. The acting is at an all time low, as is the dialogue, cinematography, story, music,everything. Uber Jason? Ugh. The attempts at comedy were juvenile and forced. Over the years I've tried so hard to give this film some type of credit, but it's just absolutely awful. The best thing about this film is the liquid nitrogen kill, but that's it. Uber Jason was a stupid idea...these types of ideas are what kills franchises.It just pisses me off. To me, this movie was even worse than Jason Goes To Hell. The death scenes were terrible except for those two that I mentioned earlier. The kill number of this movie is 24, but 2 are accidents and 2 are suicide type things so really, Jason only killed 20. So it's a relatively higher number than any of the other movies except for Freddy Vs. Jason and Jason Goes to Hell, which technically wasn't even JASON the whole movie.Serial killers don't believe in space!

This movie is about as terrible, as any low- or high-budget blockbuster of nowadays. I don't want to spread about it any longer, but I have to say that the only thing it worth seeing is the very last scene with the two teens camping out on Earth-2. To my mind, Mika Ward has the most beautiful woman's back in the whole movie history. She's SO sexy even when shot in a dark environment and only from the back. Really! Good acting (how does she move!! wow!!) and camera work here, pretty good. But that's the only good thing about this movie. The rest of the movie is terrible.The site says I have to write anything else about this crap. It's nothing special to write about: typical Jason in a typical Hollywood science-fiction movie. The silly one. P.S. But - RIP, dear Mika Ward.

Hitler invading Poland was the worst thing to happen to the world until this movie came out. This is truly awful. I can't even tell if it is actually suppose to be scary or funny or what. I feel sorry for the actors, I understand that actors need to get their foot in the door somewhere even if the movie is this horrible. Whats the plot of this movie? Whatever it is, its not a very good one. I don't like Jason part 1 through 9, I don't think they are scary, just very loud and gory, but at least they are movies and somewhat tolerable. I don't understand what these random killings and hormone driven teens are doing. Why are teens a spaceship? Why does he kill everyone and why doesn't he just kill everybody already? Must he torture us with horrible movies while doing so? What is his purpose? What will he do after everyone is dead? Sit around? Why can't people kill him? When some one shoots him he just keeps coming, its gotten old and predictable. Why even fight? You know whoever fights him is gonna die. They can at least humor me and if thats the case, why even make a movie? The answer to that is money and the existence of this movie can only be explained and justified by Hollywood trying to milk another penny out of a series of movies that for one, I never liked, and two, is growing very old at a very fast rate Horrible.

You either love this movie, or you hate it. There's not a lot of middle ground to be found here. I don't know if the filmmakers were shooting for it, but they achieved a level of shlockiness that just.... works. Is it a stupid premise? Yes. Is it ridiculously predictable? You bet your a**. But be honest, none of us watched this for high drama or Hollywood gold, because we knew it wasn't going to be here. This franchise became a cliche over a decade ago, and this film is pure, distilled cliche. Knowing that going in let's you just enjoy a film that doesn't take itself, or the genre, too seriously. I'd bet real money that 95% of the people who watched this at least giggled at, "It'll take more than that to put this old dog down; yup, that oughta do it." You don't have to love this movie, but don't look down on it because it isn't on a par with 'Casablanca'. Accept it for what it is: 90 minutes of just plain goofy, sometimes terrible, occasionally effective, jokes and one liners.

Am I right in saying this is the worst Friday the 13th ever? This movie ruined the whole name of Jason Voorhees and Friday the 13th.The acting sucked, the story sucked, I mean, what in the hell is Jason doing in outer space? The comedy sucked horribly, and was not scary whatsoever! Also, the way they killed Jason in the end would have to be the worst Jason ending ever. Getting sent flying to Earth 2? Bleh.The only remotely good part was where he got transformed into Uber-Jason, and that part wasn't even that good.Finally, the deaths of the crew: Horrible. When you compare deaths like getting head bashed against a wall with getting your head punched off? No contest.In all, this movie deserves 2 stars.

Review title: Fun and refreshing Demolition Man spin
Review_body: Fun and refreshing Demolition Man spin. The world and universe change, but Jason stays the same. I think it was a worthwhile addition, a part of me thinks the future time line gives the series a more epic canvas!

Review title: Good movie, was expecting a better script
Review_body: I was glad to see a modern version of Jason. Although the special effects were great, it lacked a few elements like suspense and a solid script.I hope the next movie will be more serious. Until then I will have to settle for the DVD.

I felt really lucky to be able to see JASON X in Stuttgart on the closing night of the Fantasy Filmfest. It was my first chance to see a Jason film on the big screen as the series went direct to video in Germany a long time ago. So standing in line for a sold-out showing of a Jason sequel in Germany used to be quite impossible to imagine.I should add that I'm a big fan of 80s slashers and the FRIDAY THE 13TH-series. My favourite Jason films so far were PART 2 as it's the scariest and Part 6: JASON LIVES that started to celebrate Jason as the unrivalled hero of the series. I had high expectations for JASON X but it still had to live up to an entire series of films I really enjoy.I can tell you it did. First of all the special effects looked really good. This isn't THE MATRIX but considering the quite low budget the space sequences looked fine. Of course, space is not what the film's about. Unsurprisingly, I was pretty sceptical when I first heard about the space setting. But this film is still about Jason and the makers aren't afraid to admit it. It really shows that both director James Isaac and screenwriter Todd Farmer are fans of the series. While Michael Myers didn't play enough of a role in HALLOWEEN: H20 for my taste, Jason is at the centre of this one. And there's no tendency to make him less evil or violent, either. There is some humour in JASON X, but that has always been part of the series. This isn't a self-ironic sell-out to audiences that are used to bad and boring films like VALENTINE and URBAN LEGENDS being called horror. JASON X is basically an 80s slasher flick with a higher budget. So if someone has a problem with the concept of a superhuman, unstoppable killing machine being the hero of a franchise, JASON X probably won't win them over. But if you like slasher flicks and therefore don't expect this to win Academy Awards I can hardly imagine anyone being disappointed. You've got your masked psychopath, a supply of pointy objects, gory and surprisingly creative kills (in particular Jason's first one aboard the space ship) and of course lots of potential victims that have no idea what they're up against. On the other hand there could have been more suspense. In that respect JASON X is similar to JASON LIVES which is fun and spectacular but doesn't really try to scare the audience too much.While two thirds of the film are good without necessarily presenting anything new, the last half hour actually has a few unexpected surprises including one of the most nostalgic and funny sequences in horror film history. I don't want to give it away but once the score from Part 1 starts playing and Jason finds himself in a familiar place fans of the series are in for a real treat. I also liked the ending very much that once again pays tribute to the series. I definitely left with a smile on my face.In conclusion I can say JASON X is the best new slasher / horror film I have seen in a long time. It has some modern elements, but it stays true to the series. I definitely recommend it!

Review title: The first horror sequel in space to pull it off.
Review_body: I expected worse considering the sorry state of horror sequels lately and the idea to put Jason in space but this movie was done well. It makes good use of gore without becoming a complete splatter-fest (I know, that would have been nice). The space scenario wasn't abused, they didn't have all sorts of high-tech gadgetry to use against Jason and when they did pull out some futuristic stuff, Jason just hacked his way through it. Almost all the people on the "transporter" were late teens/early 20s and, of course, the girls are hot. You get the prerequisite breast shots and pre-marital sex to raise Jason's ire. Also, there is some good intentional humor, essential in cheap horror movies. There is a bit of cheesiness present but not much and the movie keeps good pace and is entertaining.

Review title: Jason X had me looking over my shoulders
Review_body: Okay a lot of people I know is giving Jason X pretty bad reviews. People has told me time and time again that Jason X wasn't a good horror movie. To me, it was one of the best. All the other Jason movies had me laughing at others who seemed to be bothered and scared by Jason. This Jason movie, Had me scared. The first death scene was pretty gruesome and the way that those poor people were STUCK on a spacecraft with virtually nowhere to run to made it more scary to me. There are similarities in characters from this movie to the others..The lines that they say...like, "he is dead!", "we are safe now!" those lines we have heard over and over on all of the Jason films. But in my opinion, you have to have some common ground connecting this film to the other films. This Jason IS in a league of its own however. Its better than the Rest!!

Review title: He slices, He dices, He....well slices and dices..
Review_body: Well Jason's back, and having seen all of the previous entries to the series, I was quite looking forward to this one.  Thankfully it doesn't dissapoint and overall is a pretty good slasher movie (which may not be saying a lot for some, but you've got to judge it based on what it is). Jason does the same thing he did in the previous Friday movies, just this time he does it in space.  Acting is fine for this type of movie, which again, isn't saying much, but they hold their own.  The story isn't exactly the most well developed, and it doesn't quite pick up where Part 9 left off. I guess Jason got lost in route to hell. Anyways, the movie is good, Uber Jason is pretty cool, but Im not sure if he could be sustained for a whole movie, but if Jason X makes any money at all at the box office, I'm sure we'll find out (and maybe even if it flops).

Review title: Pure utter cheese that is so bad its not even good
Review_body: Jason X is complete utter garbage that tries so hard to pull itself off as a high budget sci-fi flick.  It basically looks like a Fullmoon direct-to-video flick, but with a higher budget than any fullmoon film. The basic plot is that Jason is frozen at Camp Crystal Lake facility in the year 2004 (I think) or 2007 and then 4.55 hundred years later he is thawed out and brought back to life by a scientist and his college students.  And get this, it takes place in space. Ok, you already knew that and so didn't I going into the movie. Hell I should have used common sense to steer clear of this, but I wanted to see a cheesy movie and Jason X oozed with it. I went and was expecting what I saw in the trailer, a roller coaster, horror cheese fest. Was I wrong though about it being somewhat decent. There is no suspense or thrills, like in the other Friday the 13ths, in this flick and the dialogue is dry and utter nonsense.  "Its ok guys he just wanted his machete back." UGH!!!  Or how about the line when one the guy (don't remember his name or any of the characters because they weren't important except Jason) is thrown on a giant screw. One of the soldiers finds him dead and get this when the captain asks the man's status the stupid bitch replies, "he is screwed." Oh dear.  Every hallway in the god damn ship has no lights. They have the technology to bring people back to life, but they don't have the intelligence to put lights in a space ship. I expected gore and rather twisted, but cool death scenes and I was disappointed once again except for one death. Just one and it was when Jason froze the hot blonde's head and then shattered it to pieces against the counter. Poor thing. Why do the hot ones always die in the beginning? Even the cutest guy was butchered 10 mins later. Dammit. At least both of them had small parts and won't be remembered being in this crap pile.  Anyways, the only good scenes were Jason's upgrade and the virtual reality camp Crystal Lake.  Oh god that was funny and possibly the best, demented sick humor I have seen in a while, those poor female campers. HEHE!!! Although, it has some good scenes the rest of movie is just plain horrible cheese that is so bad that it's not even good. Wanna see good cheese rent Jason Takes Manhattan (which is almost bad as this trash hole) or Jaws 3. The worst of the Fridays.

Review title: By far the best Friday the 13th...
Review_body: Well boys and girls, it's that time again. Time for another Jason/Friday the 13th movie. Being an Gen X'er who grew up with these movies, I have to say, when one thinks about it, this is quite an accomplishment for ANY movie franchise. I mean, how many movies make it to a -10th-, outside of the porn industry, that is? Sure, it may not be academy award winning stuff, but it's fun popcorn entertainment nonetheless. In this particular sequel, the series finally takes the well-advised turn into sci-fi-horror-humor. There are some sincerely funny, dry-wit one liners in this movie. And of course we have Jason, who, like that battery bunny just keeps going and going and going... The movie finally changes the general scenery from the other films and jumps 450 years into the future, which may not make much sense until you actually watch it, but it does make for an interesting twist in the series. Of course, as with all the previous Friday's, there are an abundance of wildly creative death sequences, a bevy of beautiful, unheard of, actors and actresses, all of whom are fodder for Jason (Kane Hodder). But then, let's be honest, if you're watching this movie, would you be expecting anything less? Rooting for Jason to kill the beautiful people is what drives the series, in my humble opinion, and there is plenty of rooting to be done in this one. Near the end of the film we get to see Uber-Jason. Futuristically reconstructed and even more unstoppable, if that was even possible. On top of all that, we even get a hilarious throwback to the very first Friday the 13th (think sleeping bags). In the end, this movie is just plain fun and well worth a trip to the theater. But if you miss it, don't worry..  the movie clearly sets up a possibility of Friday the 13th Part 11. >

I wasn't expecting much from Jason X.  I made that decision based on the last 2 Friday movies - Manhattan and Jason Goes To Hell but Jason X has to be one of my top 5 favorite Friday's.  It appeals to the old school as well as the new school fans and it also pokes some fun at the Friday series as a whole, which is totally cool.  There were some cheesy jokes but what would a Friday the 13th be without them!!  Definitely worth seeing!!

Review title: If you were a true horror fan.....
Review_body: Okay, I am sick of those 90 slasher films (I know what you did...scream....you get the point).  If ANY of you people were actually true horror fans you would give this film credit.  I want more movies like this to exist.  I hate movies where the killers are human.  That kind of scenerio is a joke!  Please support this movie and go see it so they will make a Freddy VS. Jason before Robert Englund croaks.  They won't make a Freddy VS. Jason movie if this film bombs at the box office.  I'm sure everyone can spare 2 hours of their precious time and 10.00 bucks to go see this.  I hate the whole space thing also; however, I will atleast give it a try.  If you can, wait a week or two after opening weekend; thus, horror movies do well opening weekenend then drop.  Look how well Scream did at the box office and how they soaked that franchise for everything.  I'd much rather have Jason soak up the money instead.

Review title: The best worst movie I have ever seen.
Review_body: I really enjoyed the old Friday the 13th movies, so when I first saw a commercial advertising Jason X, I knew I had to go see this one even though the movie looked horrible (haha).  This movie was unbelievably corny and silly.  At least some of the original movies in the series were somewhat believable, but Jason X was so different and intentionally humorous that I'm sure a lot of people think the movie has destroyed the franchise which became one of the cornerstones of horror.If you haven't seen this movie, but have seen some of the first ones, imagine this: Jason Vorhees set loose inside a space ship much like the Starship Enterprise on Star Trek: The Next Generation (complete with Holodecks, I'm serious).  Yeah, Jason basically walks around this spaceship with his machete and kills everybody one by one.  It's so stupid that it's funny.  The story is absolutely horrible especially with the way the movie cuts from one scene to another.I thought the funniest part of the movie was*** SPOILER AHEAD ***close to the end when the original space ship blew up, yet Jason was flying in outer space towards the ship.  That was so silly -- probably the silliest thing I have ever seen in a horror movie, or any movie for that matter.If you're a fan of the series or the horror genre, obviously you'll want to see it.  If you're looking for a quick fix / good laugh, this is also a good movie for it.  I mean, you basically have to go into this movie already expecting it to be a little random and outrageous, cause that's exactly what it is.  I'd recommend most people to wait for it to hit the $1.50 theaters or even the local video store.

Review title: A good addition to the series
Review_body: When this came out on April 26th, I figured I would have a few weeks to see it. I couldn't have been more wrong. It was out two weeks and then it was replaced by other movies coming out, before I could even see it. Fortunately, I found a bootleg of it online. Now, I'm not sure if the bootleg is a rough cut of the film or what, since I never saw it in theaters. I have to say that it was good. It was a nice change from the usual theme of Jason running around campgroundish places and killing people. Some of the death scenes were very creative (Adrienne, Kicker, and Janessa, to name a couple). The acting wasn't too terrific. Lexa Doig and Lisa Ryder were allright. I read a rough draft of the script online that had Kay-Em 14 as very perverted and humerous. I have to say I was disappointed at the lack of this in the film. Melyssa Ade truly shined here. She has some great acting skills (and her cleavage wasn't too bad either). Melody Johnson (Kinsa) came off as very annoying, and I think it took her too long to die. At first, I was a little sketchy about the space stuff, but when it comes down to it, this is still Jason at his best. Definitely not oscar material (and why should it be?) but it is a nice addition to the series. Certainly better than Jason Goes to Hell. Hopefully they'll be an uncut or unrated edition on DVD...go see it if you haven't! Any Friday fans should appreciate this.

Review title: High frag-rate, low budget, no sense.... (minor spoilers ahead)
Review_body: I was just in the mood and watched Halloween Resurrection and Jason X after another. Now i can hardly tell, which one was worse, i tend to this one. Well, i use to switch off my brain while watching Horror-Movies as it can't stand most of em for long and would gain a serious damage. Well, watching Jason X even the primary brain functions to perform life support are enough to see through this very thin story as it lacks of any surprises. To say the truth: The story is almost absent and can be told with just 11 words: Frozen Jason gets reactivated in future and kills people on starship. Ok, if it is well done, even that can be enough. In this case it is not. Seems like the director/writers of this movies just had played too much Unreal Tournament, at least Jasons Frag-Rate is the nearly the same and in the end he even gets a nice armour (well, as a player model it would look good in UT, indeed...). Sometimes they tried to make it a bit funny like scream but failed. So all what is left is  Jason killing people and even that gets boring after a while. For some decent Special FX and the nice Design of Jasons Armour it gets 2 points. For dumb characters in the movie that are -as usual in that genre- too dumb to stick together in a room and concentrate their firepower it gets one removed. Makes 1 point. If it helps to prevent part no. 11 i will give more, promised.PARA2K

First of all, anyone going to this movie intending for a good scare, you're not going to get it, but this movie is worth the trip to the theaters.Don't be fooled by movie critics that get paid to watch movies and think they know everything about movies, but they only give thumbs up to foreign films and films that have Oscar winners; Jason X is a good film to take your mate to, but the movie is really not to be taken seriously for any awards or breaking box office records.However, Jason X is a good film, regardless.  I have heard lots of critics that HAVEN'T EVEN WATCHED THE MOVIE bash the film, I will have to admit, I don't see why New Line would have Jason go to hell one installment and never explain how Jason comes back the next.Jason X is funny, exciting, and action-packed; however, it is NOT intended to be scary, but any fan of Jason knows this.  Friday the 13th and Jason films were never intended to be scary, but they were intended to be what it has been doing for 22 years, a good summer slasher film.I do have to question the Jason franchise, you have said that he died twice, but it seems that he just comes back.  I know in the sixth installment we find out how he does come back, but in Jason X, we never know how he comes back, he just comes back.  Funny how the devil doesn't want Jason around.If you're a fan of slasher films, you'll love it; if you're a Jason fan, you'll REALLY love it, if you're looking for a good film to spend some money on, you MAY like it, but one thing is for sure, you will walk out of the theater saying one word.  Sequel.

I can't believe that that was part of Friday 13th movies!!!! I enjoy that classic horor since i was a teenager, but that... I am lost for words, I can't find any bad enough words to describe what have u done with that horors series. Damn u!!! How low will some people go for money making on old glory. Thank god I didn't pay to see that move but I just downloaded it from web. BLJAH!!!

When I went to see 'Jason X' I wasn't suppose to see it at all. I was suppose to see 'Spiderman', but it was sold out. So it was either 'Jason X' or nothing. So since I was already at the theater I bought some tickets. This awful movie should be scary, but it's funnier than it is scary. I gave this movie a 1. The worse you can get. This movie sucked!

This movie is superb... I just don't know why people who give their review said that it's bad or because it's a sequel... I think that any movie, original or sequel, can be good! It's not just for money... it's for real fan who love it!... And if you're not a (real) fan, just don't see the movie... anyway, thanks to say what you think!

Let's start of with this I gave this movie a 7, not because of the great acting, story or plot (basically there isn't really one), but because of what it delivers for the old-school slasher movie fans. I gives you lots of action with lots of gore, which you've grown to expect from these movies. I saw every single friday movie at least once  and from the jason series I think I liked this one best. Again....this kind of movie in only enjoyable if you like the genre, plain and simple. Don't watch it with your friends, because they won't appreciate this side of the horror scene, as they have become used to 'good story and creepy effects' movies like what lies beneath and the others.

I remember a while ago thinking how terrible this is that Jason is going to space . . . Well, although I would loved for Jason to stay on earth and be HIM for the rest of the movie . . . this is a welcome change from one of the worst movie I have seen and not just from Friday the 13th it was horrible. Jason actually looks decent in the film until he becomes "Uber-Jason" and although he looks funny in pictures it's a little easier to stomach in the movie it self.  The score is great and it's very nice to have Harry back this time around even though there are some cheesy parts in the score. The story is good and easy to follow with some great characters and good dialogue and the acting is above average for this type of movie and it's so good not to see one of the people from Dawsons creek up there with Mr.Voorhess.  Although the story is a tad out there the beginning made it a little more believable as hard as that is to say and it doesn't get to farfetched with it being in the future. All in all I was surprised and welcome this into the series!

Review title: Totally boring sequel to overrated horror-film-series.
Review_body: I saw the movie last summer at the Fantasy-Film-Fest in Hamburg.I had seen the first two parts of the series.I expected no more than an entertaining variation of a theme.But instead i got an amalgam of no-story-script, lame pacing, no-actors and cgi-effects.A totally foreseeable storyline revolving around the resurrection of the frozen Jason through a team of university students and their professor in the future. Brought to their spacecraft and revived through nanotechnology, he promptly starts his famous walking-around-and-slashing-people. There are absolutely no surprises for even the dumbest horror-film-buff. Sorry, folks, but not even an nice try.The following maybe a Spoiler to some.Matrix-style fight scenes in which an latex-clad female android fires Woo-like her two guns at the foe. Who rises for the umpteenth time while the movie crawls to its end.But Jason-fanatics will see and buy it nevertheless.Yuck!

This movie is exactly what i was looking for in a Friday the 13th series. Death, more death, poor plot, nude girls and more death. Anyone that went into this movie expecting a nominee for best picture of 2002 should have stayed home. Of course its going to be corny and excessively violent, weren't the other movies? If you liked the other friday the 13th movies, this one will not disappoint you, sometimes you need a not so serious horror movie, this one delivers what is expected of it. I rated this 7/10 because it did just that. Gave me what i expected to see, standards were set and certainly met.

This might be the worst movie that I have ever seen. It definitely competes with Fargo and The Scorpion King for the title. Don't blow your $7.50 to watch this movie, but if you have to see it, rent it when it comes on video in the next month or so!

Review title: What the hell is this crap?!
Review_body: Who in the hell makes these movies???  This sucks!  Don't get me wrong, I'm a HUGE fan of the "Friday the 13th" Series (well, I THOUGHT it was called "Friday the 13th"....what the hell is "JASON X"?).  Even though this is the 10th installment (I guess that explains the "X" in "JASON X") of what I thought was a series, taking into account that this movie has absolutely NOTHING to do with any of the other "Friday the 13th" movies, this film just doesn't cut it.  There's not enough gore like usual, the killings suck (c'mon, why the hell would the camera cut away when someone's about to get slaughtered by the hands of Jason Vorhees!), not enough nudity, and worst of all...we get the treat of seeing "horror get an UPGRADE" - a cyborg Jason Vorhees.  What the hell is that all about!?  The fact that this whole movie takes place in space on a damn wannabe Star Trek shuttle is no picnic either.  The only thing even remotely decent about this film was the Suburban Commando (hahaha) who wasn't afraid of Jason, as well as getting to stare at Lexa Doig for an hour and a half.  Other than that, if you're a true Jason fan, then you'll understand my disgust and pure disappointment for this piece of trash, and you'll do what's best and forget that "JASON X" was even made.  To all of you lame Hollywood producers and scriptwriters, I think Beavis & Butt-Head said it best, "PLEASE STOP IN THE NAME OF ALL THAT WHICH DOES NOT SUCK!"

Review title: One of the Best Jason Flicks!
Review_body: Combine equal amounts slash and cheese, throw in some clever humor, sprinkle on some gratuitous breast shots, set it in space, and this is what comes out of the oven: one of the most enjoyable Jason flicks of the entire series!! If you're a Friday the 13th Fan (and let's face it: who isn't? ahem...) you'll love this one. Don't listen to all those whiny film students (or film students-to-be) complaining about bad dialogue and cardboard characters. Those of us in the know realize it's easier (and a lot more fun) to see people you don't care about get stalked and skewered than it would be if you liked 'em too much.Most annoying character? I'd have to say the little brunette who said "This sucks on so many levels!" Yep, honey, and you're just about to be suckin' worse than you ever have. (I won't spoil anything, but you get the idea).High marks for style and humor, the acting is decent (except, again, that annoying smart-aleck girl), the murders are great, and the special effects are impressive. Similar in tone to Jason Lives (part 6) but higher quality. Lotsa Fun! You should see it!

Review title: Jason X won't win an Oscar but its definitely entertaining
Review_body: I'm a big fan of all horror movies out there and specifically the Friday the 13th Series.  And Jason X is a great addition to the series; it is over the top and comical at times but what else can you expect for the tenth movie in a series.  Many people are bashing the movie and ripping it apart anyway they can.  Last time I checked a movie doesn't have to be the work of some frustrated artist trying to point out he flaws in our society or some other piece of trash preaching to me about what the artist feels is important to be entertaining.  If you are going to watch a Jason movie or any slasher flick then you should expect to see lots of killing and at times something comical thrown in.  If your going to see a story that says something like the Matrix or Requiem for a Dream then a slasher movie is not for you. Jason X delivers in all the ways that it should and like it should doesn't take itself too seriously and ruin the story by trying to make a Jason movie more than an unstoppable killing machine taking care of business with horny teenagers.  I highly suggest anyone who likes 80's slasher movies to go see this movie, you will not be dissappointed.  If your the type of person that orders a triple latte then maybe you should skip on this film and go rent a Disney movie.

Review title: Know what you are getting into and you will love this film.
Review_body: Let's be real, this is part 10 of what is one of the worst movie franchises in film history. It's not Chariots of Fire, it's Jason Ten. If you not only accept that, but embrace the shear ridiculousness of it, this is one incredibly entertaining movie. The filmmakers obviously didn't take themselves or their content too seriously and the film is tremendously tongue in cheek. Don't expect anything scary, but get ready to laugh. I totally enjoyed the movie, as did everyone else in the theater. If you go into with the right attitude, it's impossible not to like this movie.

I have seen every Friday the 13th movie on opening day at the theaters since part 6. This visit was the worth it. This movie rocks, not only as a well-made Jason movie but overall as a decent sci-fi slaughterfest! Slaughterfest it is, as it contains the most kills per movie than any of the previous films of the series. Being in outerspace also gives much more creativity to some of the deaths. It was cool to hear the audience cheer at the first deaths rooting for Jason, and the crowd laughing their butts off at some of the humorous bits in the film. Don't worry about not seeing the previous films before this one. If you know who Jason is, you will enjoy this film. Don't expect academy award quality. You won't find it. This movie is just pure fun from beginning to end.

Review title: I want my hour and a half life back!
Review_body: This movie was so retarded and unbelievable! Just utterly stupid. Godzilla movies of the old days was better than this. Boo! You stink! If I had a tomato I would of thrown it at the writer, then a head of lettuce at the director, and then a vegetable stand at the movie company for allowing this movie to be made. Geesh is America that hard up for entertainment! I think the writers of be Kind rewind has a greater chance of winning and Oscar, Academy award, and I would even throw in Grammy just to prove how awful this movie was. I think I am going to start writing my own Jason movies and I am going to use less money than they used to make this one and I guarantee it is going to be better than this slop that they put together.

Review title: Probably the best since the first Friday the 13th
Review_body: I thought that this was probably one of the better Friday the 13th movies in it's franchise. Granted it takes place in space but it was still pretty excellent for a B horror film. I mean did you see "Jason Goes To Hell" thats all i have to say. Kane Hodder comes back to play Jason Voorheis again and did a very good job. Lexa Doig who played Rowan was hot and played the authority female very well. Lisa Ryder as Kay-Em 14 Her scenes were hilarious.I just thought that this was a very great film and i reecommend it too anyone who enjoys horror films. Todd Farmer who worte this did a very good job. Especially after that disater of a film "Jason Goes To Hell". The actors were great, the movie had suspense , GORE, and comedy- Especially the scene with Jonathon Potts and Melyssa Ade, you all know what i'm talking about, that was hilarious. Let's just hope that if they do make another Friday 13th film hopefully it will be good as this one and that they bring Kane Hodder back as Jason Voorheis

Review title: My comments recommend the film but doesnt give anything away
Review_body: I can't say this is the best Friday The 13th film because I haen't seen the others yet. But I can say that this film made me laugh a lot and that it is definitely worth seeing, even if your not a fan of horror or sci-fi, but you musn't be afraid of some gore and violence. But there are more laughs from this film than anything else.

Review title: Jason in Space: how is that not funny?
Review_body: What most people don't seem to understand about Jason X is the fact that it is obviously a comedy. Really. Just watch it thinking that it is a spoof of Alien Resurrection and you can truly appreciate the movie. Don't try to take it seriously, because if you do, you will hate the movie, as well as miss the point. I mean, come on. It's a Jason movie in space. How can you possibly take that seriously? Honestly, no one should do that with Jason movies anyway, excluding the first one, which wasn't even truly a Jason movie. Do i need to remind you about the wheelchair death in Friday the 13th part 2? Or how about the death by weed-eater in part 7? Let's also not forget Jason takes Manhattan, which was hilarious. So, in essence, if you watch Jason X expecting to be scared or expecting a riveting plot line , you are watching the wrong movie. Go watch Halloween or the original Texas Chainsaw Massacre. On the other hand, if you want to laugh and still get to see gratuitous violence, then by all means, watch Jason X. It has all of the staples of the series and some fairly creative kills along with parts that are so ridiculous you can't help but laugh, such as the hologram sequences and uber-Jason. Overall, i think Jason X is highly underrated mostly because so many people don't have a sense of humor. The writers are obviously able to laugh at themselves, so you should be able to as well.

Jason X - Review.'Evil Gets an Upgrade', describes the way Jason goes from being a supernatural killer, with a large knife walking through the forest, looking for revenge and not really knowing where he is going.Now Jason has a new look, 'a mean, lean fighting machine', dressed like a new version of Terminator. The outcome unfortunately, is a slightly funny, unrealistic, version of some of the classics, like Halloween and the first Friday 13th. Back then people wanted to see blood, guts and plenty of stalk 'n' slash, now all we get is people coming out with some of the worst lines ever, while they are face to face with the killer. People still want to be put into suspense and this film's only positive side is that it does add a few twists towards the end.Jason can never be killed, why Jason's victims don't start to do what they are supposed to do and get running, instead of standing in their in the face of death with not a chance in the world, is beyond knowledge, this will almost certainly add more scares and humour all on its own.Overall Rating: 3/10

I give it a 4 only because of one person in the film that did a decent job & that man's name is Kane Hodder. It's a pity this has been the last time he played Jason cause he does an exceptional job. I hope Hollywood casting directors don't blame him for the piece of crap.It was all the other actors that were god awful. It was poorly written. Not an ounce of creativety other than that woman that gets frozen & smashed into pieces. That was the most entertaining death you will see.I was quite bored by watching this except for the scenes with Hodder in it. I would rate this better than Jason goes to hell as there's more Hodder/Jason scenes though jgth was far more scarier & interesting.

Review title: Although entertaining in places the film is poor
Review_body: Although sometimes funny and shocking this film fails to deliver on a number of levels. There is so much killing, that by the half way stage the film becomes a monotonous killing fest, and even the director seems bored of killing characters off. However the film is very funny (though sometimes unintentionaly), especially when the robot gets an upgrade.

Review title: Why do people watch crap like this?
Review_body: This came on TV a few nights ago and, not surprisingly, was painfully bad on just about every level. What bugs me is that they keep making crap like this because people keep watching it. I read some review on Rotten Tomatoes in which the critic, probably some guy living in his parent's basement, argued that critics would pan this film just because it's a slasher film. I think it's quite the opposite. I think slasher fans will love any piece of crap no matter how terrible it is. There are well made Slasher films. The original Friday The Thirteenth, the original Halloween, the original Nightmare on Elmstree, Scream, and many more. These weren't masterpieces of American cinema but they at least managed to be creepy and entertaining. Not the case with this. It's terribly shot, terribly acted, and, worst of all, not the least bit scary. There's never any tension in the film. Most of the deaths are quick and silly with little to no suspense or build up. Any build up that is there simply amounts to us looking at Jason standing stationary as he waits to kill someone. Why is it that horror fans can't distiguish a good slasher film from a bad one? Why do they let studios get away with crap like this? And I grow tired of the "it's tongue-in-cheek" defense. Pulling off tongue-in-cheek requires writing that's witty and amusing. Not hoping that because you're dialogue, acting, and directing is so bad that people will laugh awkwardly. I can get that boy showing home videos of kids learning to potty-train and it sure as hell wouldn't cost me 13 million dollars.

Review title: a good slasher but a cheesy end
Review_body: i think this a thoroughly good horror films which obviously will not match up to the shocks of the first in the series still does what is supposed to and in a fun way. the only problem i have with the film is the cheesy ending in which Jason is ridden into the atmosphere which just looks so cheap it is unbelievable, apart from that i would recommend it to fans of the series and of the genre. there are clever parts in the film and i particularly like the way Jason freezes a woman's head in ice before smashing it on the table, the way he falls back onto the regeneration table is kind of convenient yet this still does not ruin the film, obviously it could do better but it could also do a hell of a lot worse

Review title: Better then most of the Friday films!
Review_body: OK... I have seen this movie twice and I think that it is better then most of the Friday films but still, it wasn't the best of them though.But, Jason in space was better then most ideas. I thought this movie was better than parts 5,7, and 9. The kills are pretty cool and it has a good body count. The only thing that I hate about this movie that the acting is TERRIBLE. People start to die like every 2 minutes and that most of the characters are annoying and make dumb jokes. This is probably the least scary of the series but it is very very entertaining, and I still recommend watching this if your a Jason fan. I give this film a 6 out of 10 (Good)

Review title: Great special effets, poor story line but awesome kills!
Review_body: If you're a fan of Friday the 13th, it's a must to watch! Yeah, the plot is stupid but there's really great special effets for its time and plenty of gruesome murders yet to be seen!! I'm a big fan of the franchise and overall I'm glad I saw it.

Jason X is the second Friday the 13th movie I ever saw, while the movie isnt perfect I can still enjoy the movie some problem that I have about the movie is the CGI, it's terrible, I don't know why people hate this movie much I like how this movie tried something different with the franchise and it succeeds in that this movie isn't just a couple of teens go out in the woods and get killed this movie doesn't do that. So anyway you should check this movie out

Well, my brother told me to watch this so I did. What a waste of money they spent. They could have had much better death scenes. Only one death was half-way futuristic. The movie is supposed to be in the future so people can die in cool ways, but no. Basically the deaths contained of him stabbing people and cracking peoples bones. How boring/lame. I wanted to see more blood and more gore, and more original ways to die. They could of easily had an awesome beam death, and an awesome futuristic weapon kill. I felt ashamed of renting the movie when it was over, and even more ashamed when I found out it was late. Wow. I do not recommend this movie. Go and rent the third Jason. It's possibly the best Jason movie yet. Jason VS. Freddy is okay, but the original Jason's rock. How about Jason X2 with futuristic deaths? Hopefully they can get smart and know how to create those kind of deaths, since it's supposed to be THE FUTURE. Oh well, 2 out of 10. Watch up to the first death and then turn the movie off.

Review title: Everything a Friday fan could possibly want!
Review_body: Well, I'm sure that you're probably not going to read this since everybody said that it sucked so bad, but if you enjoy Friday movies in any way...there is no way that you won't like this one.  Yeah, he's in space, but who cares?!  It's just another reason to kill off 18 more stupid kids. As always, they think of many new ways to butcher anything that moves, and the movie is seriously hilarious (like I said, if you like Friday movies) and yes, it is intentional.  If you want to see a good scary movie, what the hell are you watching Friday the 13th Part 10 for?  It's just a bunch of moronic fun, don't look for anything past that.  Of course I am a die hard Friday fan, so if they make Friday 27 I'll be there opening day!

Review title: Jason in Space... Could have been great.
Review_body:
Jason X is a letdown, no doubt about it.  The trailer for the film looked like it would contain some campy fun, but only about the quarter of the movie really lives up to my expectations.  Maybe that is the problem I went into a 'Friday the 13th' film with expectations.The problem suffers the same fate as many horror franchises, lack of creativity.  Just seeing Jason Vorhees on screen is not enough reason to make a sequel.  Give the guy something new to do.  In this film they move Jason to a whole new setting, outer space in the future full of so many options to play with including technology, gravity, cool weapons, etc. but never take advantage of them.  Three quarters of the film could basically be from any of the previous nine films, except this one takes place on a spaceship.  I was hoping that the series would take some serious chances and almost reinvent itself like the campy horror film "Bride of Chucky" did. 'Chucky' was joy to sit through.  Sure it's not 'Casablanca', but I was entertained by the fact that I wasn't pedaled the same film as the previous three.  It strayed from the previous three films seriousness and tried some funny scenarios that were more tongue in cheek than I could have expected. 'Chucky' was a success and may have saved the dying series.
I can't say that about the 'Jason X'.  The film was given the chance and may have blown it.  People don't go to see the old horror franchises to be scared anymore.  Jason, Freddie, and Michael Meyers have become the heroes not the villains.  The directors have to start focusing more on giving the "villains" the right attitudes and unique scenarios than trying to make them creepy.  We all know Jason kills, now we want to see what happens when Jason tries to kill in zero gravity.  I thought the producers were going to try some new things with the Jason character in 'Jason Takes Manhattan'.  In the end that film turned out being just another 'F/t13th' film.  In both films 'Jason X' and 'J-Takes-Manhattan' they should have added fish out of water scenarios than looking for scares that never really add up to much.  'Jason X' could have been a hit if people were given something to leave the theatres and talk about.  All horror movie killings are the same.  Fifteen years ago they were a topic for discussion, now we want more than that.  As I said there are some redeeming scenes later in the film, that hit the exact note I was expecting to find throughout the film.  I won't reveal anything, because only if you pay to see this film do you deserve to know.I am sure when you leave the theatre (if anyone else goes to see this) thinking, why didn't they do more fun stuff like in the last 30 minutes? Maybe there were two different directors.  If I had a time machine I would go back ten years and find the guy who wrote 'JX' and put him on the right track.

I just saw this flick at the Fantasy Filmfestival in Cologne. To be honest, I never was the ultimate Friday the 13th fan, so I had really low expectations when going into the theater. As a matter of fact, I just saw the first 4 parts and think they are so-so. Jason X has not been rated (for Germany and for the US), so we saw the full uncut version in all its glory.As I said before, I had no expectations in this film. It took me completely by surprise, when I saw this great roller coaster ride full of fun and gore. Jason X doesn't take itself seriously and plays with the typical elements - just like "Bride of Chucky". There are plenty of gore scenes, which are very well done. The story... Well, do you really expect a story or characters? Jason X has only one priority: FUN.I have the feeling, that Jason X is made for the fans. Gore, twisted humor, nice ideas, typical elements (even Crystal Lake apears) and many little things only fans will notice. Everything they expected, they get here.I had a great time watching Jason X. Like it or be screwed...

Review title: Welcome return of the 1980's most infamous horror icon.
Review_body: "Jason X" is an excellent film. Simply put. The C.G.I. effects are superb and very believable. The actor's do try hard and it shows, they exchange witty comments while expressing actual fear at the same time. Kane Hodder does a great job reprising Jason Voorhees, he never says anything but he still can maintain that "Jason" feeling just by his body movements, and think that is partially the reason why this film works. I thought the idea of putting Jason in space was comical, but I wasn't so quick to disregard it because of a new setting, which many narrow-minded people have done. Jason is still himself, he just has new victims, new settings, and more advanced weapons they can fight him with. But not-surprisingly this film is absolutely flawless. There is a new element added to the series: Humor. The cast makes many one-liners and the scene in which (SPOILER) Uber Jason beats one promiscuous teen with another promiscuous teen is just flat out hilarious, it's one of those "You have to see it" moments. This is probably the most original Friday sequel, and many will say that this film does rip off Alien, but I don't think they are ripping off Alien, I feel that they were paying homage to a classic film. Overall "Jason X" is an excellent return to the big-screen for Jason, and credit is due to the cast and crew for creating an original Friday the 13th instead of staying in the woods. Kudos to New Line for going out on a limb with this film, I and many appreciate it. Hopefully this film will get "Freddy VS Jason" greenlight and lead to another Friday the 13th.

The scene with Jason killing the two girls in the sleeping bags makes this movie worth going to see!  It is soooo funny.  The rest of the movie is ok, it's your typical Jason Killfest, but it is just not the same as him killing at crystal lake.

Review title: The film keeps it's tongue firmly planted in it's cheek. The viewer should too.
Review_body: Jason X is a lot of fun.  Most people talk about how horror movies aren't scary or how slasher flicks are all the same and many won't see this movie because they are "above" this kind of filmIf you go into the movie with the understanding that this movie is made for fans of the franchise and many of the laughs are there to be enjoyed, you will like this film.  It is one of the funniest movies I have seen in a while.Now, you may think that it is not meant to be funny and I am laughing at the film, but that is simply not the case.  I am laughing at the jokes and gags that were placed in the film by filmmakers that were probably laughing harder than I was when I watched it.Don't go in thinking this is a serious horror film, because it is not meant to be taken seriously.  It has its moments of scary parts and it has its moments of gore, but the basis of the film is that it is a fun film and should be watched as a simple, enjoyable good time.  On that level it succeeds very well.

Review title: Not quite as bad as expected.
Review_body: Jason moves into the future to a space ship. It's ridiculous, fun and lots of gore for the Friday the 13th fans.

Review title: one of the worst movies in history
Review_body: This movie was so bad I was compelled to go online and write about it.reasons why this is one of the worst movies ever:1. EVERYBODY in this movie is stupid. eg. doctor just before Jason kills him: "See guys? Jason just wanted his machete back!" 2. The dialog is really, really bad. eg. "Why don't you stick your head out the door and see if Jason's gone?" 3. The weapons in this movie are very disappointing. You'd think in the far future they'd have better weapons than guns that shoot bullets. 4. The story sucks. I think they were trying to marry Friday the thirteenth with the Aliens franchise. 5. There's a lot of stuff in the movie that doesn't make sense, like: i) why didn't the guy who got impaled through the chest twice die? I know they had nanotechnology to revive him, but it took them so long to get to him, he would've been dead. ii) how did Jason's mask stay on this face throughout the movie after the doctor cut it off? iii) why did they save the really good weapons til the end? iv) why did they leave Jason just sitting in the nanotech machine, knowing it might come alive and revive him? v) why wasn't Jason blown into outer space with the rest of the ship that got blown off? 6. The ending is just so incredibly dumb when the guy flies in with the jet pack and scoops Jason away 7. Why are there 3 survivors at the end? Most movies in this series, there's only 1 survivor. 8. Speaking of the series, this movie doesn't seem to fit in with the rest of the movies at all.

Review title: Jason X was one of the most fun movies i have seen in years!!!
Review_body: Jason X, is by far, the most fun, fast, entertaining, amazing movie i have seen. Jason X keeps you on the edge of your seat the whole time. It never fails to be entertaining!! Its action packed with GREAT special effects. Some of the best explosions i have seen before. This movie is suited for lovers of all genres. I believe everyone can enjoy this movie. I recommend this movie to anyone. I am a non-horror fan, and i still LOVED IT. Thats very unusual. Even the trailer for this movie is the most entertaining i have ever seen. I urge everyone to go see this movie. YOU WONT REGRET IT!!! I loved this movie. If you love to go to the theatres to have fun, get a laugh, get scared, and just have an overall good time, this is the movie you should go see. ITS THE BEST!! 10 out of 10

Review title: the surroundings may change, the killing stays the same
Review_body: It had been quiet for eight years, but James Isaacs decided to break the silence. The result: Jason X, Friday the 13th Part 10. Everyone expected something different of course, something spectacular. If not, it is very hard to wake up interest for a horror figure of the eighties. Everything around Jason X seems to live up to those expectations, but then after seeing the movie you realise nothing has changed. Jason is still Jason, a mass murderer with an Ice-Hockey Mask who doesn't say a word, just kills everyone he meets. In the first place it is not clear why Jason came back from the dead after the "final" chapter, Jason Goes To Hell: The Final Friday. Isaacs doesn't worry about explaining this. Besides the beginning goes very fast; we don't see anything of Camp Crystal Lake and Jason is send to space very quickly so you don't have time to analyse the details of his capture. Yes, Jason has been captured and now we find him in space. There the spectator knows it is going to be different, or at least that we be logical.No way. Jason is the same cold killer as in the former movies, kills in the same way and doesn't give any surprises. And when you get finally used to that, he suddenly changes physically,  at a moment the spectator already accepted Jason stayed the same, when he reminds the former parts from the 80's and enjoys those memories. So no one wants this Robocop version of Jason, except the real fans of course (beware of part XI!!). Jason X is a disappointment, in spite of the special effects and the presence of the very pretty Lexa Doig.
Though I wish they had gone farther with the scares, it's still a very fun/enjoyable entry to the series.
Though I wish it had a bigger budget and a bigger focus on scares, it's still a bloody good time.

Certainly the most enjoyable of the Jason bunch (mostly due to the special effects now possible), Jason X provides an hour and a half of the expected mindless killing and frantic running around that we have learned to love. Refreshing are the methods that the cover boy uses to get rid of the menacing teenagers: the drill, the liquid nitrogen sink, but he certainly enjoyed using his machete in the usual manner (through skin, past the bone). Add a couple of one-liners by the hopeless crew, and you have yourself the perfect movie to enjoy without wasting precious gray matter!

Review title: Friday the 13th Fans will deffinately enjoy
Review_body: Jason X...everything you could have wanted out of this movie and perhaps the best Friday since...well...I guess #7. As I think back to all the Fridays since the original, everyone of them had a part you remember well although the movie as a whole wasnt as good as it could of been.
