This movie does a great job coming up with new and unique ways to not only Kill Jason but doesnt take away from sequels (or prequels if you may)and really comes off as a whole movie that is very enjoyable and exciting. Not only does "evil get an upgrade" but the whole movie is a 14 million dollar marvel. They really squeezed every penny out of it. I was really surprised. I really hope these guys get another one out by 2004. Enjoy

Hollywood sucks. There are many unemployed screenwriters out there with good ideas. Sure, some are bad, but hey, how much worse could those be then that movie. They can't come up with anything new these days. Comic book character movies, damn a.. remakes, or freaking sequels. How can they waste 14 Mill on such a bad script? Didn't they read it before deciding on making a movie out of it? And who finances such bull? They must be proud on their return of money. But I guess they lost anyhow, at least I hope so. No plot, not scary, not even a slasher. You can guess that I did not like that piece of crap at all (1 of 10). Waste of time, money, talent if any, and space in the theaters. I am happy I just recorded it from TV and did not spend anything but lost time on it. Right up there with Battlefield Earth. Lets see how they throw away more money on Freddy vs. Jason (not seen yet), and Alien vs. Predator.

Review title: It just doesn't get any worse than this!
Review_body: This movie is incredible... incredibly BAD, that is. I can't believe that any screenwriter and/or director is willing to put their name on this--it simply has to be an attempt on professional suicide in the business.The script is so full of cliches that belong in slasher-films of the '80s, not the new millennium. Good old Jason Voorhees gets cryogenically frozen and is thawed up several hundred years into the future, and guess what... NOTHING has changed at all. There are still tons of beautiful model-like teenagers showing their belly-buttons and having casual sex, and they all still get slaughtered by the monster in the hockeymask. This time around, however, he gets and upgrade in the last 15-20 minutes of the film, and is turned into some kind of hybrid man/monster/machine killing apparatus.The dialogue is below even the worst standards, the plot far from new, the acting is just above kindergarten ability... frankly, I don't know why any studio would jump onto a script like this.For God's sake, I know it's just another teen slasher movie based on an ancient franchise, but for crying out loud: Who ever said that innovative writing is forbidden in films like this one? I was very tempted to watch the entire movie on fast forward, but didn't.In the end, though, there is one positive thing about my Jason X experience: Luckily, I wasn't the one who paid for the rental.

well,i was expecting this movie like hell,i got the chance and i saw it now,3 months before his premiere (a lot of people saw it...why?). here´s the catch,it´s a good movie,not as good as i expected to be,but much better than JASON GOES TO HELL,there´s not much gore stuff,well,depends on each taste,but the killings are a little soft (I WANTED TO SEE JASON KILLING MORE,AND WITH VISUAL)but hey,it has some cool moments. about uber Jason? i think it´s terrific,and it´s great the info about jason´s gift to reproduce himself. if u are a Friday the 13th fan,go to see it,of course,i not,well,depends on what u like,but i got to tell you that it´s much better than all the teen horror movies thing.i give jason x an 8,some good special effects too.let´s hope that the movie make enough money to do a sequel.
If not for the really cool scene where Jason presses the researcher's face into a sinkful of liquid nitrogen and then smashes it against the counter, I would have given it a 4.

I was surprised when I went to theaters to see Jason X.  This movie was the most unique out of all the movies in the Friday The 13th series.  For gore, it does one of the best jobs that I've seen yet.  The movie also is original in many aspects.  The first is that, well, the setting is in space, almost 450 years in the future.  The second is that Jason Voorheis gets turned into a terminator-like creature, unlike the normal hockey mask (although he does wear the hockey mask for the first 3/4 of the movie.  The movie also is a good way to end the series.  Ten.  I think that this was one of the better horror movies in the last ten years.

Review title: One of the best slapstick horrors I have seen recently!(spoilers)
Review_body: If your looking for continuity in this film, well, you're out of luck bub. This film jumps all over the place with you sitting there scratching your head wondering why the guy you saw doing the girl is with the rest of the people while Jason is right behind him. Shouldn't he be back in the bedroom making love to the girl? Well, who cares? Sadly, most of the film goes on like this with many things not being explained and we are taken on a magic carpet ride to an ignorant future! Wow! Other than these dissapointing aspects of the film, I found some scenes absolutely hilarious and this is well as it balances the rest of the movie that is horribly confusing and painstakingly slow some times. The retro scene has to be the best as I have never seen something so funny in my entire life. Kudos to the director and editor for that sequence. Also, as with most slasher flicks I expected a lot of T&A however I was greatly dissapointed until that retro scene, as there were next to no nudity in the entire film!!! Sure, the girls were mainly great but still, the only one I wanted to see nude dies 10 minutes into the film. In conclusion, I would give it many pluses to see Jason fling 2 sorority sweethearts around in their sleeping bags in the retro scene, but other then that I have to say that the film was slow, clunky, and horribly boring.

Review title: The best part of the series up to date....
Review_body: This movie really amazed me, not only did i think that this would be some f*cked up sciene fiction crap, but from the picture ive seen on "future jason" this movie seemed to suck big time. But when i finally got around to watch it i was amazed. This movie is a true masterpiece with all the right ingrediences that a true horror flick should have. And Jason in space is even cooler then jason on earth.

Jason X is as all of you know the latest installment of the friday the 13th series. Thankfully, this movie ignored the 9th version of the series and went straight to the story.  In the beginning, Jason is cryogenically frozen with a woman and they are not discovered until 400-500 years later.  The two are found by a space crew made up of a greedy captain and inexperienced hot science professors.  When they melt the bodies(including Jason those morons!) Jason is out on a killing spree on this ship.Like in all movies of the series, this movie has awful acting, tons of gore, and hot young teenagers.  This movie may seem like the best one of the series but it should not take any pride in it. The only noteworthy thing about watching this awful movie is that it is noted as the horror movie with the most amount of murders. It's true but they went over the limit; at least 1 person was attacked or killed every minute in the stupidest way. Also, may I note that this movie is supposed to be a horror, but when I am watching this I sometimes think they tried to make this film a comedy. Not a good combination. Anyway, for the die hard Jason fans, go see it. For the average movie-goer, you can skip it no big deal. 3 stars out of 10.

Review title: Jason X is a great ride!
Review_body: Man, I loved this flick!  I have been holding out waiting to see it on the big screen and man am I glad that I did.  There are so many things that I loved about Jason X from the opening scene to the Crystal Lake simulation...this flick is totally entertaining and made to elicit laughter out of the audience.As I watch Jason X, I was reminded of the reason I love all of the Friday the 13th flicks...they give you a slight chill every now in then but for the most part they make horror funny...from the big breasted bimbo who thinks she hears something and keeps checking behind her until she gets distracted by something (or someone) and then ends up mincemeat to the fact that Jason always seems to twitch awake when he hears the panting of teenagers who are caught up in foreplay.This movie is totally entertaining and one that you definitely need to see in the theater in order to get the full effect...if you are looking for mindless fun and entertainment, go see Jason X!

This movie sucked because Jason in space is retarded. it was OK until the guy who got split in half was still alive,not to mention Jason with armor. the movie would have been better if Jason was restored with his normal form. even though this movie sucked i give it 3/10 because i don't know. i believe that Jason v Freddy was OK,i actually went to see it in theaters, usually i don't do that but i was bored and had nothing to do. i was rooting for Jason because i think killing people in there dreams just makes that person a pu**y. Jason has balls to go up to a dumb big breasted blonde who runs like a snail and trips over her own feet and slice her in half. thats cool.Jason does get boring because the killings are mostly all the same.

I think that the new Jason X doesn't respect the original meaning of the old Jason movies. It's not even a scary movie anymore. With the robot and all those futuristic things.They've put to much jokes and sex in the movie, If I would want to see that I would have watch 40 days and 40 nights. I think that Jason was made for movies that's taking place in the present...

in my own opinion Jason X was the coolest movie i have seen this year that is a horror flick. the effects were awsome and all the graphics everything was just so cool. the only thing i didnt like about the movie was that he wasnt superjason for very long. the costume of jason when he was upgraded was cool and so was his new hockeymask. he was also a little more stealthy than he usually is. but all around it was an awsome movie. cant wait for Jason XI.

Review title: One of the most uninspiring movies ever
Review_body: Sure, everyone wants to see the new Jason movie this year. But for those of you who are reading this and have not seen it yet, save your money and rent it (maybe). This film is riddled with bad acting, a very poor storyline and not enough content to keep anyone, including myself, interested through out the course of the movie. The few things that I liked about this movie was some of the comedy aspects, how the new Jason came to be and the suspense, as in any Jason movie. But the suspense feeling quickly faded. I was very disappointed in this movie, the storyline and the acting. As I said, honestly, save your money for this one. Joey

this was one of the best recent horror movies that came out since Jason Goes to Hell.the year is 2455(wow we`ve hit the fast forward button)anyway Jason and the woman who tried to freeze him are no aboard a futuristic ship going to Solaris(a space station i think). they first revive the girl then Jason.of course Jason goes on a killing spree,the first one is always the best(don`t play with liquid nitrogen).anyway the movie carries on with killings and the crew trying to destroy Jason. the android on board,then blows our happy cleaver weilding friend to bits,and he unfortunatly lands on a regeneration platform. This is when he gets an upgrade. i won`t say much else but it`s a great movie for a true horror fan.

If your not into jason, dont go see it, if you dont laugh at bad acting dont go see it, if you dont think the plot is laughablely lame , dont see it. If you expect that, go for it you wont be disappointed, it was laugh out loud funny!!!!!!

I don't have much to say about this movie other than if you are an old school horror fan, than this movie is for you.  There were more cleverly created kills in this movie than any horror or action movie that I've ever seen.  The dark comedy throughout was perfect and not at all meant to be taken seriously, just as the movie was.  The "Crystal Lake" recreation was without a doubt the funniest part in the movie.  It almost lost a point for the ending, but even the ending was what I almost expected and was done more for yet another laugh than anything else.  Here's hoping you go out and see this movie, because it sure beat going to see The Scorpion King.Rasmin

Jason X isn't the greatest Jason flick of all time but it's not the worst either. Lexa Doig pulls off a good performance showing that she is able to play something other then a android/warship, hopefully we'll se more movies from her. Obviously a continuing problem in Jason is the fact that NO WHERE is it explained on how Jason came back from Jason Goes to Hell! Which this isn't the first time this has been done. They also continue in changing Jason's appearance from Human, to weird freak, back to almost Human. But I guess depth of story was never the point of Friday the 13th only death. On the bright side of this movie it has what will most likely be viewed as the definitive death scene of the Friday the 13th series. I can't say now because it's only in the theater, but all will know it when they see it.

First you should know I'm a BIG F13 fan.  Jason X starts out at Crystal Lake Research Facility, where the subject Jason Voorhees is being prepped for cryonation. However, some militrastic pencil pushers decide that they could benefit from his DNA. Naturally, he gets free, kills some people and stalks the booty-licious scientist that originally wanted him to be cryogenetically frozen.  She accidently freezes herself and Mr. Voorheees.  455 years later, a space crew finds both of them, takes them to their ship and was able to revive the scientist, not Jason.  As you might expect Jason lives anyway and (in violent fashion) all hell breaks loose.This is one of the better films in the seires, but will never be as good as Parts 1 and 6.  It also contains one of the most coolest, original deaths ever that involves nitrogen.  The effects were good, the story good, the acting..... When did that ever matter in an F13 movie anyway?  Kane Hodder once again dominates the Jason persona, especially the brand spaking new "Uber" Jason, a large Robot.  This is also the first film in the series that takes the Dark Comedy movie, like so many other franchises today (Nightmare on Elm Street, Child's Play, etc.)Overall this was a good film.  Even non-fans might like it. 7.5 out of 10.

This movie is real gaga, that means a lot of fun for fans, but also fun for people with a kind of different humour.That means, someone who doesn't like such movies like Nightmare on Elm Street, Friday the 13th, Scream etc. they shouldn't see this movie, so they can't vote against this movie (very clever ha?).If someone takes such a movie any kind of serious, he didn't understand it. There are movies in the world, they don't want to tell you always 'bout real life, but they just want to entertain, and I think this is one of the way of entertainment with much more fun than the usual Hollywood-like-stuff.Indeed this movie has an own sort of quality, it is made as a high budget movie (you see that e.g. on the quality of the special effects) and expresses like "Bride of Chucky" a revival of the famous figures of the eighties like Jason (what was his real name?), Chucky or Michael Myers transfered and modernized for the new century/present time.By the way, in Germany we have a big discussion on these days about movies like Jason X or games like "Counter Strike". I just can say, I never came out of "Braindead", "Day of the Dead", "Halloween" or any other movie and wanted to kill any people, so if you feel so, dear reader, then please consult your doctor, because movies dont kill anyone, they are only something chemical projected on the wall, the question is, what we make of them, and that means, we are not guided with any movie to kill people, we always live in the wrong world, if we wish to kill... the only way to escape of this is to change our world... no one deserves to die - in reality... (what is the matrix???)

Review title: Oh, yes! Jason as he should be...
Review_body: First off, see this film. I got the chance to see this in an empty theatre - what a rush. Kane Hodder stars as Jason and who better to play him? Sean S. Cunningham as producer same as the original in 1980! THIS IS THE BEST JASON SINCE Friday the 13th Part 3! You will not be disappointed - this flick has a clever storyline, elements of black comedy, plot twists, amazing effects and so much more. Speaking for myself, I will buy this DVD as soon as it's released!

Review title: GOOD MOVIE WHAT CAN YOU SAY SAME OLD JASON NO MATTER WHERE HE IS
Review_body: If you don't know the way the chapters have been layed out (the idea)over the years then you just "go and see the new movie out".  For the folks that have seen a few or all, know what is going on and what the purpose is, and if you have watched at least a couple (3-4) of the chapters then this one is just another good old fashioned, Jason movie, and you don't really expect some big oscar winning mega hit. I chose to, on my 2 days off, before going to see Jason X, "catch up" on the other 9 chapters first, just to get a fresh idea of how they have changed in 20 years, over all I thought Jason X was really good, although they could have done without Kane Hodders own hair (or at least it looked like his own, if you ever seen him unmasked), vs. the old bald style.  I have heard this got bad ratings and i didn't know what to expect, but like I said if you really haven't followed the other 9 over the years then you'll get some people that thought it wasn't good, this is definitely a different kind of movie, one I don't think you can really just criticize like any other movie, If you like the other 9 chapters, you obviously do understand and put up with the Jason drowning as a boy/ time to get revenge story line, you'll like this one, I give it a 10 and will definitely add it to the other 9, in the old vault of F13'S.

First of all, I''m a huge Jason fan.  I even liked Jason Takes Manhattan and Jason Goes to Hell.  They all have great aspects to them.  The first couple are actually somewhat scary, but after Jason's first official "death," the films became pure emphasis on kills.Jason X lacks the suspense of its predecessors, but it provides just as much, if not more fun than most of them.  It doesn't take itself seriously, which is good.  Around 10 movies it's hard to take something like this seriously.  Some sequences are outright hilarious, such as the homage to the sleeping bag death scene from part 7.This was my first experience of Jason in the theaters, and I must say it was magic.  I got stuck with a crowd that were all fans of ole Jay.  There were cheers at each kill scene; some cheers, I even initiated.  It was a lot of fun.  As a devout horror fan, I came close to shedding a tear by the time the night was over.  It was just magic to me.  Jason X was so much fun and is an homage and parody on itself and the genre.Great ending as well.  My only problem was the lack of suspense, but I think the film made up for it just fine.  I loved it.

After seeing all of the other 9 Friday the 13th movies by now people would think they were boring but i am a fan of blood guts and gore and simply Jason was getting tired out protecting his beloved camp Crystal Lake but the 10th in the series takes a new turn with Jason being in space and committing many a few good deaths like freezing a woman's head and shattering it but stays faithful to the Friday the 13th tradition of the return of the much beloved machete for fans of horror or Friday the 13th this is a must see Roll on Jason XI

Review title: THE FUNNIEST MOVIE OF THE YEAR
Review_body: This is a must see for all Jason fans.  You will see horror, comedy, hot girls naked and great cheesy lines that will have you falling out of your seat. Quality special effects with great new ways to kill people.  Old plot takes a new twist in the future.  We can't wait for the next one.

Review title: Surprisingly well done and gory. Not as ridiculous as people think.
Review_body: When i saw this movie in the theater, i was very surprised. Believe it or not, there were only 2 corny parts; SPOILERS, when the girl got upgraded and when jason got upgraded. The killings are intense but most of them are off-screen. Personally, I think that Jason X is the best movie in the Friday the 13th series. Of course, they dont tell you how Jason comes back from the ninth film, nor will they if there is another one. I really hope that there will be another Jason movie, even though I was not a fan of the other films. But if there is one, then it will probably be like this one. The film can often be funny at times, which shows you that they are aren't really taking this film seriously, and they just want to have fun with it. 10 stars out of 10!

This movie was excellent!! It has got each and every cliché that a sci-fi horror movie should have. I was about die of laughter when i saw this movie. All you who liked, and rolled on the floor laughing when you saw the early Jason movies will absolutely LOVE this one. haha. wow. i can only say that it's one of the greatest movies i've ever seen.

Listen... A Friday the 13th installment isn't gonna take home a bunch of Academy awards so the criteria I have for the franchise is: does it entertain? And this sure as hell does. See this with a couple of good friends, grab some beverages of your choosing and just have a really fun time! It includes one of the coolest (oooops!) kills of Jason's career and it still looks pretty damn fine some 20 years after it's premier.

***possible spoiler alert***Overally, I was pretty impressed with the latest addition to the absolutely knackered friday the 13th franchise. Of course, this film won't win any awards for originality (or anything else for that matter), but never-the-less it's a pretty fun ride to watch which includes some hilariously bad one-liners ("it'll take more than a poke in the ribs...."). At first glance, the prospect of the film being set in space seems a somewhat... well... rubbish one, mainly because horror films in outer space seems rather dated these days and doesn't often pay off *ahem leprechaun 4*, but I think this only adds to the film's limited charm. Because of this we get a breath of fresh air for the Friday franchise, finally getting away from the now tedious Camp Crystal Lake and giving the fans something new to look at. I liked this film but honestly, the "uber-Jason" resembles a power ranger on steroids.my rating: 6/10

I have missed good old Mr Voorhees over the past few years and i wasnt dissapointed with his return. This film, in my mind is one of the greatest to be released in a few years and is a very worthy addition to the series. the idea of setting it in the future was a good one and the new technologies used to blast Jason with are great. IF YOU DONT WANT ANYTHING SPOILED, PLEASE DONT READ ON. The idea of upgrading Jason, though slightly tacky, was a good idea to finish of the film with. The cyborg women was a bit too much like Lara Croft in the amount she defies the laws of physics for my taste but i'm sure i will get over it.

How can I give this movie a 10 and still say it's stupid? Easy; what would you expect of a movie franchise like this to be? All along we have Jason surviving bullets and knives and being electrocuted by some means, but there was never any suggestion that his "powers" were alien in nature(like "Jason Goes to Hell suggests). Not that electricity would bring him back to life after his body was decayed for awhile(like "Friday the 13th, Part VI: Jason Lives" suggested). All of these horror movies can easily have had better plots. Why don't the writers see to it that they do? Because people like me will continue to see such movies simply because it deals with Jason, Freddy, Michael Myers, etc. Since these movies are meant to be ridiculous and silly and incoherent, then I must say that the producer and director have reached their goal. Bravo! Reaching one's goal is what it's all about, so any rating less than a 10 would be unjust.

wow, i cannot believe they took a cult classic like jason and made this film.  not only are the lines absolutely ridiculous, everything about this movie looked like it should have been played on mystery science theater. from the boy making passes at his girl-robot to the shredder looking "uber" jason, only watch this film if you want a laugh.

i have been a long time fan of the teen-slasher flicks because i am from that era, and i thought that this lastest installment was very entertaining and different. it had a new space twist done to it and i really enjoyed the futuristic jason, and maybe he will lost in space forever or maybe he will find a new batch of teenagers to kill in space either way i will be there!!!!!!!!

Review title: I thought cable was showing wrong movie by mistake...
Review_body: OK, so I watched this last night and HAD to write a review for it! I was at a friends house and he was channel surfing, he landed on this movie. The cable info said that the show we were watching was "Jason X". My friend and his roommate start talking about how Jason is in a spaceship, he's woken up and killing these people. For about 15 minutes I thought they were lying to me. I thought for sure that the cable programming was showing a different movie in error.All of a sudden, Jason appears onto the screen and I couldn't believe my eyes. I remember this moving coming out in theatres. It seemed like a made for TV movie. Not only were the effects horrible but the script was a joke and seemed as if written by a 10 year old.Most absurd line in the movie had to go to the professor when he got stuck in the room with Jason when everyone else ran off. Jason picks up his machete beside the professor (I believe it was taken from him) the professor turns around (back towards Jason) and yells out to the rest of the crew "Everyone! It's OK! He just came back for his machete!" Like actually thinking Jason was going to spare him because he 'allowed' him his machete back.Good lord! I couldn't even watch the whole thing. It had to be the worst movie I've ever seen in my life and I'm not even exaggerating a little. Horrible script, horrible acting, horrible effects, cheap overall. And did I say it was horrible??

Review title: Kill me for watching this piece of junk
Review_body: OK, i heard a lot of stories about evil Jason from Friday the 13th series so i decided to take a look at it. First one, and definitely also the last, of the series that came to my hands was this insult to cinematography mystically called Jason X. First 10 minutes i ignored all the flaws, worst acting ever seen and this laughable slaughter machine, second 20 minutes i found myself laughing cynically at every "suspense" moment and from then on i paused the movie on numerous occasions just to see how long will it take before the end.Jason X is the ultimate joke which i strongly suggest you avoid at all costs and means. Some movies are so bad that you get to like them just because of that, but Jason X unfortunately doesn't fit even into this category. It's boring piece of junk, hosting the most talentless platform of actors ever gathered around and extremely stupid plot line. Lexa Doig is a cute girl, but her acting skills will probably degrade her only to 3rd rated TV flicks shown in the morning hours.Thank you sergeant Brudski for whipping Jason to that lake which could possibly give a new bright idea for producers of this crap (Jason vs Nessie?), but you definitely won't pull my bowls once again.

Review title: Good in ways, bad in other ways
Review_body: First of all Friday The 13th series are the best. They are the most common horror films out there. Jason X has some bad glitches in it. If Rowan and Jason been frozen for 455 some years why hasn't any one found them by then? Or at least found the 8 - 10 dead guards up stairs? The film makers made it open for many options since it took place in space which is good. But it did miss alot of details in the beginning. So what now, is Freddy vs. Jason gonna take place after JGTH? (Jason Goes to Hell) and skip Jason X or is Jason X going to come over FvJ? Thats where they messed up the most, I don't think they can make another sequel off of Jason X cause his look totally changed and it wont be the same. Kane did a very good job with acting as Jason, he's the best so far. The new theme music isn't the same anymore, it just doesn't give you the feeling as (if you saw the other movies) you had during the other films... 10/10

Bones are chilled and careers are ruined in this newest chapter to a story that will unfortunately never go away. Jason, as he is known to close friends, is reborn once more to wreak unspeakable horrors in space-a horrific realm with no oxygen, no gravity, and no plot. All hopes for a storyline were lost somewhere in the first few weeks of production...of the idea for this film. If Jason would simply explain how he manages to resurge so many times, or if anyone simply had the balls to ask him, I would not be nearly as frustrated. I guess I still just don't see what the big deal is. Plenty of people have died in lakes. What makes this cat sooooooo special. Maybe it's the mask. Somebody should really tell him that the Andrew Lloyd Weber look is out. Oh well. At the end of the film, Jason is reconstructed into UberJason, a glorified, gayer version of Spawn. This was stolen straight from obscure art film Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles II: The Secret of the Ooze. The masked marauder of murder then survives several explosions and a virtual reality ruse before falling at the hands of a cosmic piggy back ride. The movie, like a derelict father, sends us to bed with no answers, just the heartwarming sensation that Jason is still alive and well. I just don't understand why anyone would fight him now. He's been to hell!! What's more extreme than that? Oh why couldn't he have been in other movies that sucked and killed all their characters? Ehem, Schumacher! Regardless, if you're looking for a good laugh and a reason to end your life, I would recommend it. It's good. Honest.

Review title: Friday Movies getting worse each movie !!!!!!!
Review_body: What a pathetic idea to do a Body Count flick in Space and even worse was the acting shown in the movie. I saw an interview with the director and he said "We were throwing idas around of where Jason X could be set" and they included ... Africa and the North Pole. why make a movie when you dont know what to do for a storyline??? Ideas should come first and then decide to make the movie! the 2 good parts were jason smashing a womans face after freezing it first with nitrogen and when he's got a sleeping bag with a camper inside and he is smashing her into the tree.0/10

So, it's another basic slasher flick mixed liberally with elements of the first Alien.  The plot is non-existent, but through ten(or eleven, nowadays), there's been maybe three plotlines between them. It's not scary.. it's not even really gory. However, the humor, which I think is intentional this time about, is absolutely hilarious.SPOILERS BELOW:Scenes such as:  The scared chick taking off in the shuttle and ramming right back into the ship like it's some kind of cartoon.  I laughed out loud.The two virtual reality campers distracting our villain from killing the real teens saying:  "Wanna drink some beer?  Or smoke some pot?  Or have premarital sex?  We LOOOVE premarital sex!!".  Taking their tops off, then tucking themselves into sleeping bags so Jason can beat them to death together.  That's absolute comedy gold.END SPOILERSOverall, it's a movie you watch with your stoner buddies to laugh at and make fun of, not to be scared.  Not being a Jason purist, I enjoyed it.

This movie was so bad I just had to write a comment.  If you've seen any of the previous flix, well... its pretty bad.  First you ask yourself how could he be alive if he went to hell.  They completely closed the series with "Jason Goes to Hell", so where did he come from? Makes you feel like this isn't even a Jason movie. It shouldn't be.  And what's with the horrible new Jason attire.  That was awful. IN SHORT, NO OPENING, BAD PLOT, ONE LINERS ALL OVER THE PLACE (CHEEEZY), BAD EFFECTS. "Big" waste of film; no really, do you know how expensive film is? Not Cheap! The only consistency this installment had with the others was the infamous nude scene, which they always find a way to put in. So there you have it.

Review title: Why the bad views? This is the best Friday since PtVI
Review_body: Less of a review of the film, more sheer confusion at the spate of poor comments this film has received.Maybe the large percentage of 'critics' are not popcorn munching Friday fans?Okay so the space setting may be a little removed from the norm, but hey, they had to get out of that forest eventually, and to be honest, so long as Jason commits his usual string of violent original deaths, who cares where he is.Anyway, back to that string of violent Death, many of Jason's best kills are in this movie (among the 30 odd he dispatches!) the frozen face smash, the corkscrew, even a send up of the sleeping bag kill and my favourite, the stylish neck break and throw to the floor (arguably just because I hated the kid he done it to so much =0) Lets be fair, that's all this film ever promised, and hell does it deliver.To put it into perspective, This film is about Jason, not the dumb kids smoking weed while they should have been in acting class, its about Jason, and in this movie Jason is quite simply 'cool', he looks great (I like the new mask, although I appreciate some do not) he moves great, he kills better. I only hope this Kirt dude can get Jason down as well as Mr Hodder!!If you were expecting a sci fi action, go watch NemesisAs a general movie, for people new to the franchise, I'd give this 8/10For Friday Fans 9.9/10So stop be so negative, and enjoy this mayhem for what it is, erm.. mayhem!!

I, like everyone else who has seen this movie, am now dumber for sitting at home and watching this pathetic film. i dont understand how anyone can make a film like this.worst story line, worst special effects and the most shallow and extremely dull characters EVER. The acting is the worst i have ever seen in my life not to mention the soundtrack which sounded like a computer midi sound it was that pathetic.In conclusion i had more entertainment when i was vomiting out of rage for seeing this utter crap of a movie.My favour to you all is to take my advice and avoid this movie at all costs.

I am going to keep this brief - as labouring over a review for this would be a fruitless waste of time for me and you.Acting performances were typically laughable. As for the horror, we have all seen more frightening displays on the Disney channel. The suspense factor was butchered from several angles, not least by the seemingly randomised synthetic score and game-show type camera-work. The violence was bloody but not excessive, and may have been a little more thrilling if I was not completely unenthusiastic about the entire setup. Still nothing was gruesome enough to penetrate my scepticism. Worst of all, the pitiable concept was not played up as a "Funny, cos its rubbish" gag. Even for a Friday 13th movie, Its just plain rubbish.

slight spoilers#Its honestly not that bad. I've seen worse in the series than I have in this movie. I actually got some enjoyment out of it. it was funny and Jason was bad ass as usual. I didn't get the whole cyborg Jason thing though. they could have kept him the same. I'm glad the series is over though. I sat for two days trying to watch them all and I'm glad this was the final one. its not as bad as Jason goes to hell or a new beginning. I just think it's a classic slasher; a group of people trapped in one place and a mad man trying to kill them. So please don't judge it before you see it because no matter what anyone says its not that bad even though he's somehow in space.

Review title: Literally the worst movie I've ever seen
Review_body: What was with that nipple scene? Like really... someone had to write that.

Review title: At least it's not Camp Crystal Lake again
Review_body: Friday the 13th was never an amazing franchise. It provided fun kills, scary moments and a solid amount of gore at it's best and awful acting, characters and plot points at it's worst. This one is not that awful though (It's certainly an improvement compared to Jason Goes To Hell). They didn't decide to beat the dead horse again and return to Crystal Lake but in retrospect, the films that were NOT about the usual formula of Friday the 13th we're all familiar with were actually the worst. This time around we're provided with some lame excuse for Jason to go to space/the future so he can kill more annoying teens. The series obviously needed a change but in my opinion, this was not the way to do it. The acting and characterization is dreadful but we never expected much from these movies in that department anyway. At the very least it's entertaining, and has some fun kills. Also, for some reason characters just love to spit out cheesy one liners right before die (?) which was a pathetic attempt at comedy if that was the intention. I think this sequel was completely unnecessary, and it didn't fit anywhere in the series time-line. It's still a solid choice if you're bored and want to kill an hour and a half though.

This movie sucks!!! OMG! This concept was so retarded!! A movie is NEVER good if set in space!! We are supposed to pretend that this movie never happened for the movies to make sense. If only it never did happen... This movie does not even follow any of what Friday the 13th is supposed to be about! I cannot believe how some people think this is such a great movie. I am glad I did not spend my own money on it, it was a gift. The video store where my friend works at had so many copies that they were giving them away...for free! No wonder that each Jason movie that comes out does worse and worse. The writers no longer care about genuine plots and scripts, they keep recycling the same thing over and over.

I love of Jason movies but why the direct didn't continued after Jason X . He is well modified more than ever and badder. Give us something you can make blow our minds away. I would to see a new one come and make it more scary . I know you can do it and am sure plenty people will agree to what I have said . You can also make it more than 2 hrs and we over the camp area scenes its getting boring and am sure the actor think so too. Make it in a different area like maybe in Russia or maybe Transylvania that sounds scary too. I don't even see they making anything scary as Jason movies or even Freddy either, things start getting boring we need more real horror not those movies they making with lots of suspense and a little bit of horror. It's not the same anymore. Please do something great and make us be amaze of something new with real horror!!!

Review title: it ain't that bad, but ain't that great either!!
Review_body: This film isn't the best, but isn't the worst storyline I've ever seen. take the characters for example, its true that none have been in a film prior to this shambles, however they are now part of the Friday the 13th saga, and that in itself is legendary. with the exception of Friday the 13th part four, the series has been on a downward slope since the third film which was diabolical!! worse than this film. the actors show that they aren't all that experinced, but jason makes up for it with stunning visuals and a scary new look. all in all this film is only worth watching if you don't care about missing out on the next hour and a half of your life, however is good for a laugh, and if you like the Friday the 13th series then you should enjoy this one, even if it is only for the laughs. check it out for yourselves, with new gory ways to die, very updated, but perhaps to much.

I'm not a hardcore horror/slasher enthusiast, so I enjoyed this movie, thought it should belong in the comedy/horror section (if there was one). A movie I could enjoy watching again. This is sort of a 'Jason meets Star Trek' blend, certainly not a typical horror film, no doubt hardcore horror/slasher fans are the ones giving it a rating of 1. I thought 'Uber Jason' was great, Lexa Doig is hot hot hot, the scene where Jason beats one topless camping chick with the other topless camping chick in their own sleeping bags in the VR room was hilarious! Some funny tongue in cheek one liners as well. More nude babes would have been nice, though :)

As someone who's a big Friday the 13th fan, this film is so stupid. First off, why send Jason to space. second, how did he get out of hell between this film and Jason goes to hell. finally, that ending was stupid but entertaining. This film is so bad its good, as in its fun to watch if you don't take it seriously. one kill in particular is entertaining in which Jason freezes a scientists head and smashes it is entertaining. other than that, don't watch this movie unless you don't want to take it seriously. on the bright side however, this film is still better than Jason Goes To Hell

OK So not the greatest movie of all time but it is certainly entertaining. I have been watching the Friday the 13th series since I was a teenager, I'm now 21 and I still love watching them. Jason X however was very different from the others. Firstly more modern, better quality camera work etc but still a really cheesy film non the less. Jason really does seem to be some sort of super-sonic being. He's impervious to all weapons and is attacked numerous times all in the space of an hour and he still keeps coming. Impossibilities do become possible in this movie and some scenes really did have me laughing my head off. If your a fan of the series then watch it, but if you're looking for a scary movie then find something else, enjoyable but not great!

This is the best film ever made. The best film ever made used to be Jason Takes Manhattan, but now Jason is in space, which is crazier than Manhattan, so now Jason X is the best film ever made. Jason Takes Manhattan will have to settle for second place. Sorry, Jason Takes Manhattan.

Review title: Jason x is one of the most mind numbing films there is
Review_body: this film has got got to be one of the most stupid films i have every seen not only does it lack story line it also has unbelievable characters, far from being a grisly horror it has turned into an almost slap stick comedy . i love to watch a good horror film and when i saw this advertised i thought it might be good to watch, but as i watched it i began to realise that i had a big mistake, as about five minutes into the film i began to fall asleep. There was not one thing gripping in the story line and nothing that made me want to keep watching , but i made myself watch it to the end just to see how predictable the end would be and in my view the this film was extremely predictable and crap.

I love the whole genre of the slasher flicks from the 80's and I don't mind at all that they are carrying on into the 2000's. Jason is one of my favorites but there's no way this movie is considered horror. If you are the kind of person who likes the blood/gore/suspense of a classic horror flick do not watch this movie. You will be greatly disappointed. Jason X is far too sci-fi and not enough scary. Also, I would love to see the day where the idiotic people in these movies realize that they can beat the crap out of Jason all they want and he won't die. It would be nice to see something different going on here. As Kay is shooting Jason for the tenth scene in a row, I started wondering, "Is this all that's ever going to happen to poor Jason?"
